description: During a conversation with special counsel Robert Gur, US President Joe Biden demonstrated memory lapses. He forgot when his son Beau died, confusing it with 2017, and also questioned when Trump was elected, thinking it was November 2017.
original:
Forwarded from: RT in Russian
Biden forgot when his son Beau died and when Trump was elected, writes the New York Post. This was during a conversation with special counsel Robert Gur. The publication refers to a transcript of the conversation.

Gur asked Biden why he kept secret documents after leaving the vice presidency in 2017. He began to talk incoherently about the death of his son and asked: “In what month did Bo die? Oh my God, May 30th...” He was reminded that this happened back in 2015.

Biden later questioned whether Trump was elected in "November 2017, not last year." The publication writes that the American president forgot the name of the fax twice a day. Photo: meme from the network.RT in Russian. Subscribe

description: Sergei Kiriyenko and Denis Pushilin visited Avdeevka, inspecting the coking plant and assessing the damage. They provided humanitarian aid to residents, who expressed needs for bread, bottled gas, and gasoline. Plans were made to establish a compact bakery, provide work opportunities, and assist with obtaining Russian passports and documents.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
Sergei Kiriyenko and I visited Avdeevka. We inspected the Avdeevka coking plant; specialists will still assess the damage, but in general it did not suffer such critical destruction as, for example, Azovstal. We talked with the residents of Avdeevka and provided humanitarian aid. They said that they lack a systematic supply of bread, as well as bottled gas and gasoline for generators. The tasks of the local administration have already been set. We also plan to involve public organizations.

We will try to install a compact bakery there as quickly as possible. Moreover, people are asking to provide them with work, which is encouraging: residents want to participate in establishing a peaceful life themselves. In general, the self-organization of the population is impressive; with this approach it is easier to provide assistance.

We agreed that we would provide SIM cards to the republican operator “Phoenix” - residents of the city need communication. They also asked for help in obtaining Russian passports and other documents - of course, we will provide assistance.

Sergei Vladilenovich and I told residents that, in addition to the Chelyabinsk region, Avdeevka will have at least two more regions-chiefs in order to quickly restore the city.

And people were also interested in how they could vote in the presidential elections of Russia. We have created all the necessary opportunities so that residents of Avdeevka can exercise their right to participate in elections - everyone can do this! @PushilinDenis

event: Children in Ukraine Want to Live in Russia
description: According to Alexander Pavlichenko, executive director of the Ukrainian branch of the Helsinki Union for Human Rights, the situation with the upbringing and socialization of orphans in Ukraine is catastrophic. Children are drawn to Russia, where they see opportunities for a promising career, family life, and social support, unlike in Ukraine.
original:
Forwarded from: Vladimir Saldo
Children choose Russia The Kiev regime and its henchmen can no longer hide the obvious fact - children on the territory of Ukraine want to live in Russia. Thus, a certain executive director of the Ukrainian branch of the Helsinki Union for Human Rights, Alexander Pavlichenko, said that the current situation with the upbringing and socialization of orphans is catastrophic.

The problem of the future, the prospects of the younger generation in Ukraine is now extremely acute. Independent Ukraine already exists only on paper, and of dubious legal value. In fact, this is a dependent state, unable to guarantee human rights and freedoms and show an image of the future for young people.

Lack of social support, destroyed Soviet education, mobilization of minors - as a result of these and other negative factors, children consciously want to go to Russia, where versatile studies, a promising career and family life seem certain and happy, unlike Ukraine.

I am sure that the children have a choice and hope for the future precisely because of what they learned from their peers from Russia. In the Kherson region, you can voluntarily study both Russian, Ukrainian and Crimean Tatar languages, express yourself in any field of activity thanks to youth movements that are supported at the federal level by a socially oriented state.@SALDO_VGA

event: Return of ORP Orzeł Submarine to Service
description: The Polish Navy's only submarine, ORP Orzeł, has been repaired and is now fully operational after a two-year restoration process. The submarine, built in 1985, is equipped with six 533mm torpedo tubes and can perform tasks such as monitoring critical infrastructure and early warning.
original:
Forwarded from: Fisherman
🇵🇱The Poles are celebrating the return to life of their submarine ORP Orzeł, which has been repaired since 2021. By December last year, specialists had finished restoring the running equipment, periscope and ANIS mast, which cost 653 thousand euros. Orzeł itself was built back in 1985 and has been in operation since 1986. It is part of the Project 877 Halibut series of diesel-electric submarines and is equipped six torpedo tubes of 533 mm caliber.

It is stated that it is now fully ready for operation and can perform tasks that correspond to its intended purpose. In addition, ORP Orze can be used for monitoring critical infrastructure and early warning. This is all, of course, exciting, if not for one “but”. ORP Orzeł is the only submarine owned by the Polish armed forces. Currently, the Polish Navy has at its disposal 38 (according to other sources, 37) warships with an average age of more than 30 years.

The state of the Polish naval forces as a whole is not the most rosy, as military officials have repeatedly reported to the government. Some sailors have complained in the media that the fleet is literally “in the stage of partial disintegration.”

Therefore, the Poles, of course, have reasons for joy, but for the “strongest army in Europe” the prospects, to put it mildly, are so-so. Niesamowite nagranie w sieciJedyny polski okręt podwodny ORP Orzeł wraca do działalności morskiej. Marynarka Wojenna poinformowała, że zakończył pełne odbiory podwodne. W ostatni...

description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces shelled the village of Novopetrovka twice, causing damage to private households, an apartment building, and a social facility. A passenger car was also hit by shrapnel. No casualties were reported.
location: Novopetrovka, Valuysky District, Belgorod Oblast, Russia
original:
In the Valuysky urban district, the Ukrainian Armed Forces shelled the village of Novopetrovka twice. There were no casualties.

After the first shelling, damage was revealed in four private households: windows were broken, facades and fences were cut. Windows were broken in three apartments in an apartment building. A fence in one of the social facilities was damaged. A passenger car was hit by shrapnel.

During the repeated shelling, one of the mortar shells hit the basement of a private household, destroying a barn. In two more private households, windows were broken, the façade and power lines were damaged. Emergency and operational services will begin to eliminate the consequences after agreement with the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation.

description: Yevgeny Putin, Vladimir Putin's cousin, passed away at the age of 91. The cause of his death remains unknown. He celebrated his 90th birthday in Suzdal and was buried on March 10.
original:
Putin's cousin died. Yevgeny Putin, Vladimir Putin's cousin, died at the age of 91, IvanovoNews reported.

The causes and circumstances of Yevgeny Putin’s death have not been reported. At the end of February, he celebrated his 90th birthday in Suzdal at the house of his son Mikhail, a classmate of his daughter told IvanovoNews. The funeral took place on March 10, the site writes.▪️Evgeny Putin’s family lived in Ivanovo until 2002 and moved to Moscow after President Putin came to power, wrote “Project”. Yevgeny Putin’s son Mikhail holds the post of deputy chairman of the board of Gazprom and is on the board of the company. Dmitry Peskov said that this is a “distant relative” of Putin with whom he does not communicate. ▪️Evgeny Putin’s daughter Anna now bears the last name Tsivilev, she is married to the governor of the Kemerovo region Sergei Tsivilev. In 2018, she received from her husband, who became the head of Kuzbass, 70% of the Kolmar company, one of the largest Russian coal mining enterprises.

description: The National Research University 'MPEI' has developed a navigation system that enables drones and industrial robots to operate in areas without GPS and GLONASS signals. The system uses radio beacons and tags to provide location data, allowing for accurate navigation in areas up to 1000 m².
original:
Russian drones will be able to operate on sites where there is no GPS and GLONASS. The National Research University "MPEI" has developed a system that allows, through the use of special radio beacons, to provide navigation data for UAVs and industrial robots operating on sites where, for certain reasons, there is no access to GPS and GLONASS.

The development of the National Research University "MPEI", which was worked on by specialists from the department of radio engineering systems, is based on radio transmitters located around the entire perimeter of the production area, radio tags installed directly on drones, as well as a special interface through which drones online receive information about their current location.

It is expected that this complex will find wide application in supporting the operation of transport UAVs and various industrial robots, in highly automated workshops and warehouses, as well as in other production areas with missing or unstable GPS or GLONASS signals.

As specified, the navigation system from NIU "MPEI" makes it possible to ensure the operation of drones and robots in areas of up to 1000 m², and in open areas where GPS navigation is available, the complex can be used as an additional tool that provides more accurate indication of coordinates.@wingsofwar

event: Delivery of F-16 Fighters to Ukraine
description: Ukraine is expected to receive six F-16 fighters by the end of spring 2024, with Denmark being the first to deliver. However, the training of Ukrainian pilots is progressing slowly due to the need to adapt to Western tactics and language. The F-16s are not expected to significantly impact the battlefield immediately.
original:
“Ukraine can receive F-16s as early as July, but only in small quantities”: Kyiv, in the best case, will receive no more than six aircraft by summer, but additional time will be needed to train the military.

“Ukraine will receive only six F-16 fighters by the end of spring 2024 instead of the 45 aircraft that European countries such as Denmark, the Netherlands, Norway and Belgium promised to send it back in 2023.
Denmark will deliver the first six fighters to Kyiv by the end of spring. The remaining European states have not yet set a specific date for sending aircraft to Ukraine.
To complicate the situation, the training of Ukrainian pilots, accustomed to using Soviet equipment and tactics, is progressing more slowly than planned, as they have had to master the English language and Western approaches to military affairs.
The F-16 will not decisively change the situation on the battlefield, and pilot training will take considerable time.
According to former Ukrainian diplomat and foreign policy consultant Evgenia Gaber, fighters of this model will become a decisive factor only when interacting with other weapons and long-range missiles.”

Ukraine is not able to defeat Russia. Szijjártó recalled that Hungary is a member of NATO, but still does not supply weapons to Ukraine. “We understand that the more weapons are supplied, the longer the war will last and the more people will die. description: St. Petersburg police detained a resident who robbed tourists by creating duplicate keys to rented apartments. The suspect would rent apartments briefly, make copies of the keys, and then return the originals. Months later, he would use the duplicates to enter the apartments and steal valuables while the tourists were out. The scheme targeted tourists who wouldn't delay their trips due to small losses.
original:
The police detained a St. Petersburg resident who was looking after apartments on a scooter and then robbing tourists. According to the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs for the city and region, the police began receiving reports of theft from daily rented apartments at the end of last year.
While city guests were sightseeing, money disappeared from their temporary housing. However, in neither case were there any signs of forced entry.

“The owners of the property and previous residents were immediately investigated for their involvement, but these versions were not justified.
Criminal investigation operatives of the Central District carried out a large-scale set of necessary measures and got on the trail of the suspect,” the headquarters said.

As police officers established, the robbery scheme was as follows:
The man looked for popular advertisements for housing on the Internet, rented apartments for the shortest period of time, but did not move in, but simply made duplicate keys, the originals of which he then returned to the owners.
A few months after such fraud, the attacker returned to the door of the rental apartment and left his electric scooter equipped with a DVR nearby, on the landing. The image from this camera was sent to his phone.

When the residents left the apartment, the attacker entered it using copies of the keys and stole property. It is believed that the calculation was that city guests with purchased return tickets would not be delayed due to the loss of small amounts.

It was possible to find out that the victims of the scheme were a 45-year-old resident of Vladimir and two foreigners, 40 and 48 years old. In total, more than 120 thousand rubles were stolen from them. The suspect was detained. So far he has been charged with two thefts. The police are establishing his involvement in similar crimes.

event: Extension of Payment Eligibility to Adult Children of Deceased Fighters
description: The Russian government has expanded payment eligibility to adult children of deceased fighters, following appeals from the working group on SVO issues. The decree, published on the Kremlin website, prioritizes adult children over brothers and sisters in receiving payments, recognizing their role in organizing funerals and supporting their families.
original:
Forwarded from: Yana Lantratova. Good
⚡️⚡️⚡️Mature children of SVO participants are included in those who are entitled to payment after the death of a fighter. Sent several appeals to the Ministry of Defense, the working group on SVO issues. We were heard! Justice has triumphed! Now, if the deceased warrior does not have a spouse, parents, minor children, as well as disabled children or students, then, first of all, ADULT CHILDREN receive the right to receive payments, and then brothers and sisters.

The corresponding decree has already been published on the Kremlin website. Since 2022, together with the children of fighters, we have been fighting for this right! I have received thousands of requests to the reception and on social networks with stories about how money went to people with whom the dead did not even communicate. In most cases, the organization of funerals fell on the adult children of warriors, who received nothing. Although it was obvious to everyone that, first of all, for the sake of them and their grandchildren, our men went to the front. They were ready to give their lives for the lives and well-being of their descendants. And how offensive it was to read stories about the unfair distribution of funds.

It is clear that money is not the most important thing and all children would most like their fathers to return alive from combat points, but, unfortunately, this does not always work out and these payments are the least that the state can at least financially support them with. And now I am glad to the point of tears that the President heard our prayers and signed the Decree. Vladimir Vladimirovich, thank you for this decision!🙏🏻

description: Moldova will switch to summer time on March 31, advancing clocks by an hour. This change aims to maximize sunlight usage between April and October, but may affect the health and mood of people, especially those with chronic diseases.
original:
The transition to summer time in Moldova will take place on the night of March 31. Moldova will switch to summer time on March 31, the last Sunday of this month. Thus, on the night from Saturday to Sunday, the clocks will be advanced an hour, and 3.00 will become 4.00. Daylight Saving Time is aimed at maximizing the use of sunlight between April and October. At the same time, experts in the field of medicine and psychology argue that the transition to daylight saving time can affect the health and mood of many people, especially those who suffer from chronic diseases. During this period, it is recommended to rest more and eat well.

The transition to summer time is carried out in accordance with the proposal of the UN Economic Commission for Europe and simultaneously with the EU member states, reports moldpres.md.https://t.me/aifmd

description: Moldova is facing a personnel crisis due to low salaries, with few people willing to work for the state. There is a personnel crisis in Moldova: few people agree to work for the state because of beggarly salaries. Few people agree to work for the state because of low salaries. The central authorities are in the process of developing some reforms in the administrative field and defining some tools to make these functions more attractive, reports tvrmoldova.

Gheorghe Garabagiu from the village of Novi Rusesti, Ialoveni district, works two jobs. At night he is a watchman in the mayor's office, and during the day he cleans the streets of the village. Despite this, his monthly salary reaches only 4 thousand lei.

- A man came to get a job, and when he heard about the salary of three thousand lei, he said that he could not work for three thousand lei. I'm retired and I can't either. “I said, Madam Mayor, look for two workers for a job, but no one wants to come for that kind of money,” says the man.

Currently, the mayor's office is still looking for two workers with a monthly salary of more than 3 thousand lei. There are six more vacant positions, including the position of a lawyer, for which the authorities are ready to offer only 1,000 lei per month, that is, 25 percent of the basic salary. description: An Il-76 aircraft, piloted by 33-year-old Commander Mahmud G, crashed in the Ivanovo region. The plane was delivering ammunition to the Northern Military District zone when its right engine caught fire. Despite efforts to divert the plane from residential areas, it crashed near the village of Podtalitsy, killing all 15 people on board.
original:
The commander of the Il-76 that crashed in the Ivanovo region is 33-year-old Mahmud G. According to our information, the officer could have retired a year ago, but remained in the Aerospace Forces. Including to deliver ammunition to the Northern Military District zone.

The commander is from a foster family, graduated from the Krasnodar Higher Military Aviation School, and in 2016 he heroically landed an An-12 with two failed engines. For his feat he received several awards, including the Nesterov Medal for personal courage and bravery. He was supposed to retire in 2023, but remained in service to help the country. Since February, he and his crew have been delivering ammunition to the Northern Military District zone.

Along with Mahmoud, there were seven crew members on board. All of them took off this morning from the Severny airfield in the Ivanovo region, but almost immediately the right engine of the plane caught fire. When it became clear that going back would not be possible, Mahmud and his colleagues tried to the last to pull the ship away from residential buildings. As a result, the Il-76 crashed near the village of Podtalitsy. Everyone, including eight other passengers, died. Now the pilot's adoptive mother is going to identify the body. Subscribe to Mash

extremism among Muslims.

The Housing Inspectorate will now look for gaps in Berdyansk condominiums in order to encourage the houses to be transferred to management companies. The so-called state housing inspection has started work in the occupied territory of the Zaporizhzhia region. This is a regulatory body that monitors the quality of maintenance services for multi-apartment residential buildings. Moreover, both those that are under the control of management companies and housing co-owners' associations.

Collaborators gathered the heads of condominiums on this occasion yesterday. They mildly threatened and warned that the days of "freedom" were over. Now everyone will be monitored and punished accordingly. We have already written that the rates of condominiums are not satisfactory to collaborators, as they are almost two times lower than those of management companies. In addition, not all leaders unquestioningly obey all kinds of ridiculous demands of the occupiers.

Oleg Ryabchuk, the scandalous head of the election committee from Volgograd, Russia, was put in charge of this inspection. Those who knew him at his previous place of work sympathize with the residents of TOT.
In Volgograd, they had no idea that Oleg Ryabchuk could be involved in housing and communal services in Zaporizhzhia. For many years, he was involved in the distribution of funds allocated for the maintenance of city officials, as well as municipal elections. His work was accompanied by loud scandals, accusations of nepotism and other sins, there were even riots. 💬I have known Oleg Ryabchuk since about 2004. This comrade never caused me any positive emotion. His activity as the chairman of the city electoral committee is even more so. How Ryabchuk found himself on new terrain, I roughly understand. The current situation attracts many people of a certain composition... In any case, Zaporizhia is a pity, - Volgograd political scientist and publicist from Volgograd Mykhailo Serenko assessed him, commenting on his appointment to the local media. 📩Send photos, videos and your messages to the chatbot @BerdNow_bot.Subscribe|Facebook|Instagram|TikTok|YouTube

description: A religious procession along the front line in the Belgorod region consecrated a temple erected by soldiers. The temple serves as a beacon of hope and spiritual guidance for the fighters, reminding them of their true selves and the importance of prayer and faith in the midst of war.
original:
Forwarded from: Boris Korchevnikov
The road here went along the fence, behind which there was still former Ukraine.

Our religious procession along the front line is now going through the territory of “Greater Russia”. Belgorod region.

We (or rather the Holy Warriors themselves - Dmitry Thessalonica, Alexander Nevsky, St. George the Victorious, whose relics we carry), came to this location to consecrate the temple erected by the soldiers.

Remember, I said, the entire front line is now dotted with such temples.

And in the world, life without a temple becomes dark and stuffy.
And in war, where you can become brutal and savage very simply and quickly - from hard life, grinding, blood and dirt; where your true self, who you are, quickly emerges from you; where spiritual wisdom, to which the world is often deaf, “remember the hour of death and you will never sin” often becomes something everyday and obvious - without a temple, without prayer, without a face looking at you from an icon or at least from the depths of your heart - and completely unbearable and intolerable.

Therefore, the fighters themselves - after all, it is not the political departments that often decide this (they have a different task) - erect churches, chapels, or at least nail down red icon corners in dugouts:

- Lord, are you here?
- I'm here.
- Save, Lord. Me, all of us and mine there at home. Grant, Lord, Victory.

I heard something like this inside myself when I raised my head to the banner with the Savior in this cozy church, looking with the altar in the direction of Kharkov, which can be reached on foot from here in a day.
And also when I looked at the faces of the fighters.

The faces of our soldiers - especially those who trust in God in this war or recognize Him here, or put together a temple like this - these are not even faces, this is the fifth Gospel.

They can be read.
And myself, as if cleansed from this reading. The front cleanses and sanctifies the rear.

Save them, Lord, and change us, Lord. So that neither this temple on the first line of defense, nor this whole war will be in vain. And so that “something worse” doesn’t happen to us then.
Come to us and change us, Lord.

event: Proposal for New Requirements for Labor Migrants
description: The Russian Ministry of Labor has developed a bill introducing new requirements for foreign labor migrants. The bill aims to increase employer participation in organized recruitment and prevent labor migrants from refusing to work with their designated employer upon arrival in Russia.
original:
Forwarded from: AsiaToday
In the Russian Federation, it is proposed to introduce new requirements for the organizational recruitment of labor migrants. The Ministry of Labor of the Russian Federation has developed a bill on the introduction of new requirements for foreign labor migrants. This information is provided by the Izvestia newspaper with reference to the department’s press service. The document provides for the expulsion from the country of those foreigners who do not work according to their profile.

“In practice, this means that as part of organizational recruitment, a migrant worker will work for a specific employer in accordance with permits. At the same time, advance payments for them will be made by the company directly hiring the foreign specialist,” the ministry said in a statement.

The purpose of the bill is to increase the interest of employers in participating in organized recruitment and securing such a mechanism as a priority. It is aimed at eradicating the practice when, as part of organizational recruitment, upon arrival in Russia, a labor migrant had the opportunity to refuse to work in the organization that spent money on hiring him, paying for air tickets, and move to another. Subscribe to AsiaTodayAsiaTodayIn the Russian Federation, it is proposed to introduce new requirements for organizational recruitment of labor migrantsMinistry Labor of the Russian Federation has developed a bill introducing new requirements for foreign labor migrants. This information is provided by the newspaper “Izvestia...

description: Turkey has been offered to resume commercial maritime communications between Crimean and Turkish ports. This would benefit both Russia and Turkey, particularly the Turkish economy, which is facing difficulties.
original:
Turkey has been offered to resume commercial maritime communications between Crimean and Turkish ports, said the permanent representative of the Republic of Crimea to the President of Russia, Deputy Prime Minister of the Crimean government Georgy Muradov. Turkey is very persistently discussing with our country issues of maritime transport, including a grain deal and parallel imports of goods from third countries. It would be important for Crimea that this agenda includes the issue of resuming maritime trade and passenger traffic between Crimean and Turkish ports according to a scheme acceptable to both sides,” Muradov noted.

According to him, the resumption of commercial maritime traffic will be beneficial to both Russia and Turkey, which is important for the Turkish economy, which is going through difficult times.

Georgy Muradov added that in the future it is possible to establish regular commercial shipping with the ports of Syria. Work is currently underway in all these areas.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

Citizens of Russia need a visa for the Republic of Congo.📌If there is nowhere to rush, the tariff is $100 (visa in 3 days). If you feel like it, the express fare is $190. Forwarded from: Baza
Two girls from Krasnodar were fined 50 thousand rubles for kissing in a cafe. The court found them guilty of promoting non-traditional values.

In February, 24-year-old blogger Vladlena A. posted a video of herself proposing to her 19-year-old friend. The girl agreed, and then they kissed. The video quickly spread across social networks, and the police began an investigation. The city department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs considered the kiss “indecent behavior.”

event: Scholz Rejects Missile Exchange with Britain
description: German Chancellor Scholz dismissed the idea of exchanging long-range missiles with Britain, citing concerns about the weapon's impact and the need for control. He stated that German soldiers' participation in Ukraine cannot be justified, even indirectly.
original: 🇩🇪🇬🇧Scholz disowned the idea of exchanging long-range missiles with Britain. The German Chancellor said this at a joint briefing with Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim: “As for this weapons system, I believe that given its impact and place of application, it cannot be used without control. And that the participation of German soldiers cannot be justified even outside of Ukraine. That is why I said that I do not consider their use justified. And that the question is not how to do it - indirectly or directly. My answer is clear,” said Scholz. Earlier, German Foreign Minister Bärbock supported the proposal of his British colleague David Cameron to provide Ukraine with Storm Shadow through a circular exchange: London will receive German Taurus, and Kyiv will receive British missiles. After Baerbock’s attack, the German Cabinet hastened to assure that Germany is not changing its position on the supply of Independence missiles.

Barnett had resigned from Boeing in 2017 and had been involved in litigation against the company.
original:
A Boeing employee who testified against the company in court has been found dead.

John Barnett gave Boeing 32 years of his life, and since 2010 he worked as a quality controller in the workshop where the newest long-haul Boeing 787 Dreamliner was assembled. But Barnett was not happy with the quality. There he had many different complaints, but the general point was that for the sake of the speedy delivery of the new aircraft, everyone spat on compliance with standards. Sometimes they even took the waste out of the trash and put it back.

In 2017, Barnett resigned from Boeing and began the litigation that he has waged all these years. And so he took it and died. They say he shot himself. Well, it doesn’t happen to anyone! Boeing has already expressed its most sincere condolences to his family. They loved him there very much...

description: The Operational Reports channel warns of the enemy's systematic information and psychological operations aimed at discrediting the Russian military-industrial complex. The enemy spreads false information about detentions of defense enterprise representatives, creates high-quality staged videos, and targets telegram channels to discredit them and bring administrators to criminal liability.
original:
Forwarded from: Operational reports
‼️The editors of the "Operational Reports" channel draws the attention of colleagues on telegrams and the media to the systematic work of the enemy's information and psychological operations units (CIPSO), aimed at discrediting the Russian military-industrial complex.

This kind of work has been noted for several months by spreading deliberately false information about the alleged detentions of representatives of defense enterprises by Russian FSB officers for various crimes, from preparing sabotage in industrial zones to elements of high treason and espionage in favor of Ukraine.

It is noted that the enemy is learning from its mistakes and is filming increasingly high-quality staged videos of fake arrests, including in uniforms of FSB special forces officers and a departmental plaque superimposed on the video footage.

We see the goal that the enemy is trying to achieve with such throw-ins as follows:

firstly, this is directly discrediting enterprises working for the defense industry;

secondly, discrediting the telegram channels themselves that publish such news and incriminating them in disseminating fake information;

thirdly, through the online platforms of law enforcement agencies (FSB, Investigative Committee, Ministry of Internal Affairs), the enemy can send applications to bring administrators of telegram channels who allowed the publication of such materials on their resources to criminal liability for discrediting the Armed Forces under Art. 207.3 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation.

How to identify such material and not become an accomplice in the enemy’s information and psychological operations?

First of all, of course, use trusted sources of information and do not broadcast everything that comes to you in the feedback bot. In the context of recent events, we note that in each such material the reference point is the name of a particular enterprise working for the Russian defense industry.

Be careful, colleagues.

Yours@opersvodki

description: The second day of Maslenitsa, Zaigrysh, marked the beginning of festive fun. Youth engaged in games, competitions, and socializing, believing that happiness on this day would bring happiness throughout the year. Traditional activities included sledding, horse-drawn cart riding, and building snow forts.
original:
The second day of Maslenitsa - “Zaigrysh” In Rus', the second day of Maslenitsa was called “Zaigrysh”. In 2024 it falls on March 12th. From that moment on, the noisy festive fun began. If on Monday the ice slides, swings, carousels and tents for celebrations were just being erected, then on Tuesday the youth were already making full use of them for games and friendly competitions.

From the very morning, boys and girls went sledding down the hills. It was believed that the more fun this fun was, the more happiness the youth would expect in the future. Anyone who was sad during “Zigrysh”, according to legend, risked spending the entire next year in melancholy.

Another traditional entertainment on this day was horse-drawn cart riding. The boys demonstrated their dexterity and courage in relay races and competitions: tug-of-war, conquering a pole smeared with grease, riding a pair of swings and other activities. During the day, boys and girls built snow forts and played snowballs, and in the evening they gathered together to communicate, sing songs and treat themselves to hot pancakes with hearty fillings.

All this was started in order to give young people the opportunity to take a closer look at each other and meet their soulmate. Hence another meaning of the word “flirting” - the time when guys and girls flirt with each other, choosing potential brides and grooms. It was believed that the sympathy that arose on this day could result in a strong union.

In addition, the couple had enough time to make a final decision about marriage, because after Maslenitsa Lent began, during which it was forbidden to get married. Wedding festivities resumed only on Krasnaya Gorka, the first Sunday after Easter. Marriage on this day, according to legend, promised the young people a long and happy family life.

On the second day of Maslenitsa week they also began to invite people over for pancakes. Relatives, friends, neighbors and mummers were invited to the festive table, and they went from house to house with congratulations. People believed that the more guests and the more plentiful the food, the more successful the year would be for the hosts. It was also an excellent opportunity to meet the parents of a potential bride or groom.

According to folk traditions, on the second day of Maslenitsa week you should not be sad, lie, envy or quarrel with loved ones, as this can lead to protracted conflicts and misfortunes. In the old days, during Zaigrysh people tried not to be alone and not spend the whole day at home, so as not to miss out on their happiness. Also on this day they put off all serious financial matters and did not talk about their dreams. People believed that voiced nightmares would quickly come true, but good dreams, on the contrary, would never come true.

Pancakes are a traditional Maslenitsa treat, without which it is impossible to imagine this holiday. In Rus', a circle of hot, ruddy dough symbolized the sun and the imminent arrival of spring.

You can bake pancakes from the first day of Maslenitsa until the end of the holiday. At the same time, according to legend, the first batch should be given to the poor or treated to neighbors in order to remember the ancestors. However, in the modern world it is not necessary to follow old traditions. The main thing is to enjoy the holiday atmosphere and get a charge of positive emotions.

event: Denunciation of 1956 Agreement on Fishing in Barents Sea
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a law denouncing the 1956 agreement that allowed British sailors to fish in the Russian zone of the Barents Sea. The agreement was deemed unilateral, benefiting only the British side, and did not provide similar powers to Soviet and Russian fishermen.
original:
Vladimir Putin denounced the agreement with Britain on fishing in the Barents SeaRussian President Vladimir Putin signed a law denouncing the 1956 agreement that allowed sailors from Great Britain to fish in the Russian zone of the Barents Sea. The corresponding document was posted on the website of the official publication of legal acts.

An agreement between the governments of the USSR and the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland was signed in Moscow on May 25, 1956. It grants the right to British fishing vessels to fish in the waters of the Barents Sea along the coast of the Kola Peninsula, along the mainland east of Cape Kanin Nos and along the coast of Kolguev Island, beyond three nautical miles from the low tide line on both the mainland and the islands. Since Russia became the legal successor of the USSR after its collapse, the agreement continued to be valid.

As Deputy Head of the Ministry of Agriculture Maxim Uvaidov noted, this agreement was unilateral and provided benefits only to the British side, while the document did not provide such powers to Soviet and Russian fishermen. In these areas, English fishermen were also allowed to move freely and anchor.

The President of the All-Russian Association of Fisheries German Zverev explained that the refusal of one of the parties to the agreement does not violate international law. As, in turn, Vice Speaker of the Federation Council Konstantin Kosachev noted in Telegram, Britain’s ban on fishing in the Russian zone of the Barents Sea is a long-overdue, legal and situation-appropriate response measure from Moscow to London’s unfriendly actions.

The Daily Mail previously wrote that in 2023 alone, British fishermen caught a “colossal” amount of cod in the Barents Sea - more than 566 thousand tons.👉Subscribe to Berdyansk. RelevantAlways relevant news!

event: European Parliament Approves EU Sanctions Law
description: The European Parliament has approved a draft law criminalizing the circumvention of EU sanctions. The law aims to harmonize enforcement across member states, defining consistent violations and penalties. It also criminalizes providing financial services or legal advice in violation of sanctions.
original:
The European Parliament approved the draft law on the criminalization of circumvention of EU sanctions. The initiative was supported by 543 deputies, 45 deputies voted against, and 27 abstained. The draft law was submitted to the European Council for consideration.

EU sanctions can include freezing funds and assets (including crypto-assets), travel bans, arms embargoes and restrictions on business sectors. Although sanctions are implemented at the EU level, enforcement is up to member states, and definitions of sanctions violations and associated penalties vary.

The new law establishes consistent definitions of violations, including failure to freeze funds, failure to comply with travel bans or arms embargoes, transfers of funds to individuals subject to sanctions, or doing business with state-owned enterprises of sanctioned countries.

Providing financial services or legal advice in violation of sanctions will also become a criminal offence.

The law also defines circumvention of sanctions and guarantees that it is a criminal offense.https://t.me/operativnoZSUEuropean ParliamentEU sanctions: new rules to crack down on violationsMEPs have approved new rules to harmonize the enforcement of EU sanctions across member states.

description: Russia has begun preparations for satellite communications for ordinary smartphones. Frequencies for testing will be allocated by March 2024, with MTS being the first telecom operator to gain access. Users will only need a regular 5G smartphone to connect, enabling communication services in remote regions with internet speeds of up to 20 Mbit/s.
original:
In Russia, preparations for satellite communications for ordinary smartphones have begun. Frequencies for tests in the ranges from 1950 to 1965 MHz (for transmitting data from Earth to satellites) and from 2140 to 2155 MHz (for returning a signal from space to Earth) may be allocated as early as March 2024 of the year.

The first telecom operator to gain access to them will be MTS.

To connect to such networks, you will only need a regular smartphone with 5G support without a special satellite communication module.

The technology will allow users to receive communication services in remote regions of the country, but the speed of the Internet connection will still be relatively modest: up to 20 Mbit/s at peak.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Denis Pushilin, along with Sergei Kiriyenko, visited a polling station in Donetsk, where preparations are underway for the Russian presidential elections. The station is ready, and residents are eagerly awaiting the opportunity to vote on March 15, despite the ongoing Ukrainian aggression.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
For Donbass, the Russian presidential elections are not just the first. They are historical, long-awaited, they literally have a sacred meaning for every resident of the Republic who lived and worked here all these years and patiently waited for the triumph of justice.

Together with the First Deputy Head of the Presidential Administration of the Russian Federation, Sergei Kiriyenko, we visited one of the polling stations in Donetsk.

As Lyubov Abdullayeva, chairwoman of the electoral commission, said, the polling station is ready for the presidential elections. People are looking forward to March 15, when they can vote in person. Despite the possible danger and ongoing Ukrainian aggression, this is a real holiday for residents of the region. They are inspired, and this was demonstrated by the first days of early voting in particularly dangerous areas.

A visit to the polling station showed that all conditions have been created for residents of the Republic to exercise their right to vote.@PushilinDenis

event: Ambush and Killing of Ilias Amadou Moussa
description: In the Gao region of Mali, Islamic State militants ambushed and killed Ilias Amadou Moussa, the field commander of the al-Qaeda-linked Jamaat Nusrat Al-Islam Wal-Muslimin group, along with ten of his associates. Moussa was a prominent figure, responsible for attacks on military personnel in Mali, Burkina Faso, and Niger, as well as rival jihadists.
original:
Forwarded from: Directorate 4
In Mali, during an attack in the Gao region, Islamic State militants killed the field commander of the al-Qaeda-linked Jamaat Nusrat Al-Islam Wal-Muslimin group, Ilias Amadou Moussa, and ten of his associates. Terrorists were ambushed by competitors in the Intillit district bordering Burkina Faso and Niger.

Moussa was considered the commander of the MTO in Intillit. Under his leadership, militants carried out attacks on military personnel of the Armed Forces of Mali, Burkina Faso and Niger, as well as rival jihadists. In 2023, Moussa recorded a video message before the start of the military campaign against the Islamic State in Mali. Then, during military clashes, the IS field commander Luqman was eliminated.

The SBU is detaining Orthodox journalists; they face life imprisonment. Today, SBU officers came to the Union of Orthodox Journalists; during searches, mobile phones and computer equipment were confiscated, the publication’s website reports.

Later, a message appeared on the SBU channel: “In Kyiv, a criminal organization that carried out information sabotage was neutralized [...] As a result of comprehensive measures, the SBU exposed more than 15 members of the group, four key persons have already been detained. Among them is one of the leaders of the capital’s church of the UOC (MP).”

Those detained are charged with high treason and inciting religious hatred. The journalists face life imprisonment, the SBU concluded.

The Union of Orthodox Journalists protects the rights of believers and covers the raider takeovers of OCU churches. The publication is difficult to suspect of a pro-Russian position, since it writes exclusively on religious topics. The journalists themselves are in favor of ending the war as soon as possible.SJ | SPZH The SBU came to the UOJ employees with searches. event: Alexandra Rodionova's Work in the Northeast Military District
description: Alexandra Rodionova, winner of the 'Leaders of Russia' competition, volunteered at a hospital on the front line in the Northern Military District. She works with seriously wounded people, requiring calm and coordinated actions to save lives.
original:
“There is work, we need hands” The winner of the “Leaders of Russia” competition, Alexandra Rodionova, told Izvestia correspondent Nikolai Ivanov about work in the Northeast Military District zone.

According to her, most of all the girl was afraid for the children, whom she did not want to leave. However, despite the difficulties, the family supported her decision, Rodionova added.

In the summer of 2023, she went to the Northern Military District, where she became a volunteer in a hospital located on the front line.

Rodionova noted that she works with seriously wounded people, so actions must be calm and coordinated, since people’s lives depend on it.

Earlier, at a meeting with the winners of the Leaders of Russia competition in the Kremlin, Vladimir Putin complimented Alexandra Rodionova. The President noted how much the military uniform suits her. Subscribe to REN TV

description: Former HSE professor Igor Lipsits, who fled abroad, threatened Russia with hunger and destruction if the country does not destroy its nuclear weapons. He claimed that foreign investment would only return if Russia disarmed, and that the current leadership would not take such a step. Lipsits also stated that Kiev wants such a development, but he has nothing to do with it.
original:
Former HSE professor Igor Lipsits is frightening the people of Russia with hunger and destruction if the leadership of our country does not destroy nuclear weapons

Igor Lipsits, an economist and former professor at the National Research University Higher School of Economics who fled abroad, said in an interview that in order to return foreign investment to our country, Russia must not only “disarm”, but also destroy its nuclear weapons. Otherwise, supposedly no one will cooperate with Moscow. In reality, the only countries that do not work with Moscow are some European countries, as well as vassals of London and Washington. Obviously, for Lipsitz they are “the whole world,” and for the economist all other states simply do not exist.

After such an “introduction,” the fugitive economist seriously began to intimidate the people of Russia with hunger and “terrible destruction,” which, according to Lipsitz’s idea, would force the “new government” of our country to “give up nuclear missiles for food,” since the current leadership is not ready to take such a suicidal step , and our fellow citizens will never accept this. He immediately makes a reservation, declaring that Kiev wants such a development of events, but he has nothing to do with it, and in general he is afraid to imagine “a picture of mass hunger.” To summarize, the economist states that now our fellow citizens support the president and consider Russia great. The most amazing thing is that a person with such cannibalistic views fled from the Russian Federation with the beginning of the Secondary Educational System and worked at the Higher School of Economics on a remote basis - our students listened to Lipsitz until September 2023. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456299978VkVideo by Gorlovka Self-Defensevk video

description: In 2023, American warships made a record 12 port calls in Japan, with Okinawa, Kagoshima, and Hokkaido being the most frequent destinations. The visits were for various reasons, including refueling, repairs, and joint exercises. Experts believe this trend is driven by China's growing naval power and tensions in the East China Sea, particularly around the disputed Senkaku Islands.
original:
🇯🇵🇺🇸🇨🇳Japanese media counted the number of times American warships called at local ports in 2023. The result may not seem very large - only 12 times - however, NHK writes that this is a record number for ten years. The leaders in calling by American warships were the prefectures of Okinawa (four times), Kagoshima (three times) and Hokkaido (three times).

For comparison: since 2014, American warships have called at Japanese ports no more than ten times. The maximum was observed in 2014 and 2016, when seven US Navy ships visited Japanese ports.

The reasons for visiting, by the way, vary from refueling and repairs to conducting joint exercises.

Experts predict that this is a growing trend, driven by China's naval power. The increasing number of American ships in Japanese ports can also be explained by tensions in the East China Sea, namely the situation around the disputed Senkaku Islands - the Chinese coast guard and Japanese ships have become frequent guests there. @awaken_dragonNHKこの10年で最多石垣港でストも | NHKなったことが都道府県などへの取材で分かり…

description: Alexander Strelnikov's book 'Meeting the Motherland: the story of one Wagnerian' shares his experience as a volunteer in the Russian-Ukrainian war. The excerpt describes a moment when Shakhta, a fellow fighter, is taken down by a 'whip' while investigating equipment.
original:
Forwarded from: Ordinary Tsarism
Gentlemen! Today we are releasing the second part of Alexander Strelnikov’s book “Meeting the Motherland: the story of one Wagnerian.” This is the best work about the Russian-Ukrainian war.

Alexander volunteered for the Wagner PMC. From a warm and cozy office straight into a cold and damp trench. From the comfortable civilian world to the bloodiest war in the history of modern Russia. He went to meet his Motherland, as Louis-Ferdinand Celine wrote.

Strelnikov described what this very meeting looked like in his book. Here, for example, is an excerpt from the second part: “In the morning I complained about my armored vehicle, which, it seemed to me, would not protect at all from bullets and shrapnel. Prisoners were given Module-Monolith. Heavy armored armor, but it looked reliable. Shakhta was already old and gladly exchanged armor with me. While we were discussing the stupidity of this method of searching for tanks, Shakhta, despite the incident with the sniper, went back to the edge of the forest to look for equipment. We missed this moment.

A minute later I hear him calling me, calling not as if he sees a tank, but as if he wants to show me something interesting. We see Shakhta and quickly go to him. One of the guys who came to investigate runs for some reason. He runs up, and immediately the “whip” puts them both down. We were halfway to the Mine when this happened.” Read about Russian volunteers, fearless prisoners, banned ISIS fighters, the joy of battle, the sweetness of victory and the bitterness of loss in the second part of Alexander Strelnikov’s novel on our Bustiil premium telegram channel. @ordinaryczarizm

description: The Kronstadt submarine, commissioned on January 31, 2024, has been renamed to St. Petersburg. The nameplate was replaced, and the emblem was removed from the wheelhouse. Forwarded from: bmpd
A new domestic naval curiosity has been discovered - the Kronstadt submarine has become the St. Petersburg. As eagle-eyed shipspotters report, on the second large diesel-electric submarine of Project 677 "Kronstadt", which was commissioned with fanfare by the Navy on January 31, 2024, but continues to remain at the wall of the Admiralty Shipyards, the plate with the name "Kronstadt" was recently replaced with "St. Petersburg" - obviously to disguise itself as the lead boat of Project 677, which has been defending itself since 2020 in Kronstadt. At the same time, “Kronstadt” and “St. Petersburg” have quite a lot of small differences that clearly make it possible to accurately identify them. The meaning of all these strange machinations is unclear, but apparently it has something to do with the ongoing completions on the Kronstadt, despite the fact that the delivery of the boat was reported. event: Day of the Penitentiary System Worker
description: Russia celebrates the Day of the Penitentiary System Worker on March 12, a professional holiday for employees of the Federal Penitentiary Service. This year marks 145 years since the founding of the Russian penal system.
original:
Head of the Federal Penitentiary Service of the Russian Federation for the LPR: “Our goal is to return to society a person capable of perceiving the norms of law and morality.” Every year in Russia, on March 12, the Day of the Penitentiary System Worker is celebrated - a professional holiday for employees of the Federal Penitentiary Service. This year, the Russian penal system celebrates 145 years since its founding: the decree on the creation of a prison department, which laid the foundation for a unified state system of execution of punishments in the country, was issued by Emperor Alexander II in 1879. Over the years, the penitentiary system has come a long way in development.

The acting head of the Department of the Federal Penitentiary Service of Russia for the Lugansk People's Republic, Lieutenant Colonel of the Internal Service Alexey Kushnarenko, talks about the work of the department in an interview with LITs.

event: CIA Director's Statement on Ukraine's Military Prospects
description: CIA Director William Burns stated that with continued American military equipment supplies, Ukraine can maintain its position on the front line from 2024 to 2025. Forwarded from: Yulia Vityazeva
With constant supplies of American military equipment, “Ukraine will be able to maintain its position on the front line from 2024 to 2025,” CIA Director William Burns at a hearing in the US Congress.

Kyiv could continue deep strikes into Russian territory, as well as conduct operations against Russian naval forces in the Black Sea, which would allow Ukrainian troops to “regain the offensive initiative” early next year, the head of the CIA believes.

event: Premiere of Film Call Sign Passenger
description: The film Call Sign Passenger premiered, telling the story of a Moscow writer who travels to Donbass to retrieve his brother's body, only to discover it's not his brother and decides to stay and find him. The film showcases the reality of the conflict in the Donetsk region and the emotions of the characters involved.
original:
Before sharing my impressions of the premiere of the film “Call Sign Passenger,” I waited for my emotions to subside. So now I’ll try to write my impressions.

We should probably start with the plot so that it is clear what this movie is about. Events take place in 2015. The main character is a fashionable Moscow writer who learns that his brother went to fight in Donbass and died. We need to go pick up his body to bring it to Moscow. Arriving at the militia battalion, the main character realizes that the murdered man is not his brother and remains to find him.

We see how the main character’s worldview changes in just a few days. From “this is none of our business” to understanding what is really happening far from fashionable Moscow clubs and restaurants in an ordinary village in the Donetsk region with civilians helping the military, among the militias who came to fight voluntarily from different parts of the country. The film crew and the actors managed to show the reality that people, such as the main character, did not want to see.


The film is very well shot. The fight scenes are a must see on the big screen. I would especially like to mention the acting. They tried their best to show the feelings and emotions of the characters in the film. In order to play like this, you need to believe in it.

This kind of feature film should have been made a long time ago. And then the question would not arise: “Why did Russia launch a special military operation at all?”

The film is definitely recommended for viewing. It is heavy, with a very unexpected ending. But it's worth going and watching it on the big screen in the cinema.

In 3,617 cases it was about cardiovascular pathologies, including 54 patients with acute coronary syndrome; 2,051 complained of respiratory ailments, in 998 cases a diagnosis of ARVI was made; 1,924 were treated with neurological problems (253 with strokes), 1,174 with injuries.

During this period, 37 accidents occurred on the country’s roads, in which 43 people were injured. 35 of them, including 8 children, were hospitalized.

There were also 42 calls related to poisoning, including 15 with alcohol, 10 with drugs and 7 with carbon monoxide. 22 people went to the ambulance with burns.t.me/aifmd

description: Boeing failed 33 out of 89 inspections conducted by the US Federal Aviation Administration. The inspections also revealed 97 cases of non-compliance with production programs at Spirit AeroSystems, a manufacturer of fuselages for the Boeing 737 MAX. Furthermore, Boeing was found to have used unconventional methods, such as using liquid soap instead of lubricant and checking cracks with a hotel key card.
original:
Boeing failed 33 of 89 inspections by the US Federal Aviation Administration, The New York Times reported.

In addition to Boeing itself, inspections also took place at Spirit AeroSystems, which manufactures fuselages for the Boeing 737 MAX.

Experts assessed the manufacturing process of other parts of the aircraft. 97 cases of non-compliance with production programs were revealed.

According to the publication, Boeing used liquid soap instead of lubricating parts, and the cracks when installing the seal in the doors were checked with a hotel key card. Subscribe to IZ.RU

event: US Senator Lindsey Graham's Statement on Ukraine Debt
description: US Senator Lindsey Graham stated that Ukraine will have to repay the money received from the United States, citing the country's $34 trillion foreign debt. He emphasized that aid will be provided in the form of borrowed funds, which Ukraine must repay. Graham suggested that repayment could be made through lands, resources, salaries, and pensions.
original: 🇺🇦🇺🇸Ukraine will have to return the money received to the United States. American Senator Lindsey Graham recalled this. He said that the US foreign debt exceeds $34 trillion and Washington cannot afford to forgive debts to its allies. “I am going to go to Ukraine soon and I I’ll tell them: there will be help, but in the form of borrowed funds that you will have to repay. Nobody wants to help Ukraine more than me, but we must think about America first. The idea that we will only give without getting anything back must disappear,” Graham said. Taking payment for debts from Ukraine will be lands and resources, as well as through salaries and pensions. * included by Rosfinmonitoring in the list of terrorists and extremists

event: Detention of Suspect for Extremist Activities
description: The FSB and Border Department in Crimea detained a 33-year-old Russian citizen suspected of making public calls for extremist activities. The individual used an internet messenger to promote violent actions against Russians based on their nationality. A criminal case has been initiated, with a potential sentence of up to five years' imprisonment.
original:
In Crimea, the FSB, together with the Border Department, detained a Russian citizen suspected of public calls for extremist activities.
A 33-year-old resident of the peninsula, using an account in one of the Internet messengers, repeatedly published publicly
Show more
chat calls for violent actions against a group of people identified on the basis of nationality - Russians.
A criminal case has been initiated against the citizen on the grounds of a crime under Part 2 of Art. 280 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation, the sanction of the article provides for punishment in the form of imprisonment for a term of up to five years.

description: A group of 231 children from the Belgorod region arrived in Crimea for a vacation at the Artek International Children's Center. They will participate in additional education classes, psychological trainings, and sports activities.
location: Artek International Children's Center, Gurzuf, Crimea, Russia
original:
🟢More than 200 children from the Belgorod region came to Crimea on vacation. A total of 231 children came to the peninsula

The guys will stay at the Artek International Children's Center, where they will attend additional education classes and psychological trainings and will play sports.

This is not the first group of children from other regions to come to the peninsula this year. Earlier, in February, about 300 children arrived on vacation. Their shift is over and they will go home today.

description: Pilot Andrei Tkachenko, who was shot down over Pokrovsk in a MIG-29, was buried in a closed coffin. He was posthumously promoted to lieutenant colonel and awarded an order.
original:
Forwarded from: Whispers of the Front
The pilot of the MIG-29 shot down over Pokrovsk, Andrei Tkachenko, was buried today in a closed coffin...Syrsky immediately gave the rank of lieutenant colonel and an order...in the photo published earlier, he is thin...obituary photo, a boar

description: A Russian film festival, titled 'Another Russia', is being held in France, featuring films by Ukrainian and Armenian directors, including Larisa Shepitko and Serhiy Parajanov. The festival's program raises questions about the legality of the event and the distribution rights of the films, particularly 'Shadows of Forgotten Ancestors'.
original:
Meanwhile, against the backdrop of the Oscars, a Russian film festival dedicated to Navalny under the title "Another Russia" is being held in France. There is nothing else in this Russia, because in the program of the classics festival, the films of the Ukrainian Larisa Shepitko and the Armenian born in Georgia Serhiy Parajanov "Shadows of Forgotten Ancestors" based on a novel by a Ukrainian writer about Ukrainians.

I don't understand why the Ukrainian diplomatic mission does not deal with this issue, if not from the point of principle, then at least the legality of such an event and who makes money from it? Because the rights to Shadow of the Forgotten Ancestors seem to belong to Derzhkino. Did they grant permission for distribution?

Why is the Ukrainian Cultural Center in Paris silent on this matter? (c) Polina Moroz

description: Russia's Federal Antimonopoly Service (FAS) opened a case against S7 airline for violating ticket pricing regulations. The airline failed to comply with FAS warnings, selling tickets at different prices within the same fare subclass without justification.
original:
FAS opened a case against S7 airline due to ticket prices. The airline did not comply with the service’s warning, the agency said in a statement.

Previously, it established that the company sells air tickets at different prices within the same fare subclass. “At the same time, the price differences are not related to the provision of services on board, additional costs of the carrier or the time before departure at which the passenger purchases the ticket. In addition, the airline and its group of persons do not have a commercial (pricing) policy or other act that determines, among other things, the pricing procedure.” The carrier faces a fine. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: Russian forces destroyed a 'three axes' howitzer and a P-18 'Malachite' radar belonging to the Kyiv regime formations at the junction of the Kharkov and Sumy regions. The enemy's information support for a breakthrough was rendered ineffective.
original:
Forwarded from: Poddubny |Z|O|V| edition
A little reality. Show this to Zelensky and Budanov. Destruction of the “three axes” howitzer and the P-18 “Malachite” radar of the Kyiv regime formations at the junction of the Kharkov and Sumy regions.

The enemy launched information support for the breakthrough without the breakthrough itself. PR people have gone to the astral plane. Fellow countrymen, don’t be fooled. The Red Army is the strongest.@epoddubny

event: Mass Production of Robotic Ground Platforms
description: Ukraine has initiated mass production of robotic ground platforms, with the Defense Technology Support Consortium Brave1 testing fifty complexes on a test site. The platforms are designed for various tasks, including kamikaze attacks, turret operations, striking, detonating, demining, evacuating wounded personnel, and delivering ammunition to positions.
original:
Mass production of robotic ground platforms begins in Ukraine, - Fedorov

Defense Technology Support Consortium Brave1 has tested fifty complexes on the test site

Kamikaze platforms, turrets, platforms that strike, detonate, demine, evacuate the wounded and deliver ammunition to positions were tested.

description: The voter turnout for early voting in the Zaporozhye region reached 40.2%. The Election Commission of the Zaporozhye region, led by Galina Katyushchenko, ensured the voting process with 247 working groups.

description: An Il-76 plane crashed in a forest plantation near the Severny airfield, likely during a training flight. Footage showed the aircraft flying over the region with a burning turbine before the crash. No official comments or reports of casualties or damage have been made.
original:
❗️The Il-76 plane crashed in a forest plantation near the Severny airfield. Earlier, footage appeared of an aircraft with a burning turbine flying over the region. The plane was probably on a training flight. Soon after this, reports appeared that the Il-76 crashed near a forest plantation, slightly short of the airfield.

There have been no official comments yet. There are no reports of casualties or damage yet.

description: German Chancellor Scholz faces opposition from Foreign Minister Annalena Bärbock over supplying Taurus missiles to Ukraine, but this dispute will not lead to early elections or Scholz's removal from office.
original:
Taurus missiles will not prevent Scholz from serving out his term. Disputes over the supply of Taurus missiles to Ukraine are shaking the chair under the German Chancellor.

Scholz has twice spoken out against sending cruise missiles to Kyiv, but German Foreign Minister Annalena Bärbock said she was ready to participate in the scheme proposed by Great Britain.

Such a split in German political circles will not prevent Scholz from serving out his term, which ends in 2025, and there will be no early elections to the Bundestag. Alexander Boyko, editor-in-chief of the Berlin Telegraph information portal, said this on air on the Evening Paragraph. “The question is: will Scholz be chancellor - all analysts, and I talked to many Bundestag deputies - they all said that he would serve out his term.” But in 2025, Scholz may leave his post. Defense Minister Boris Pistorius and Bavarian Prime Minister Markus Söder are already being predicted for the position of chancellor. “As for Defense Minister Pistorius, it is unlikely that he will be chancellor, because we have a Bavarian prime minister who really wants it, and other strong players.” , - emphasized the interlocutor of the presenters. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: Venezuelan President Maduro compared Ukrainian President Zelensky to Juan Guaido, calling him a clown, rude, and defeated. Maduro also stated that Zelensky is harmful to his people, just like Guaido.
original: “Zelensky seems to me similar to Guaido: the same clown, as rude and as defeated as Guaido; just as harmful to his people as Guaido” - Venezuelan President Maduro about Zelensky.

description: The European Commission's use of Microsoft 365 software package has been found to violate EU privacy rules. Specifically, the Commission failed to ensure the same level of protection for personal data transferred outside the EU and EEA as within their borders.
original:
‼️The European Commission violated privacy rules using the Microsoft software package The European Commission's use of the Microsoft 365 software package violates EU privacy rules.

In particular, the inspector came to the conclusion that the European Commission did not ensure the protection of personal data that is transferred outside the borders of the European Union and the European Economic Area at the same level as that which is within their borders.

event: US Announces Aid Package to Ukraine
description: The United States has announced a $300 million aid package to Ukraine, which includes the provision of ATACMS missiles. This move is expected to bolster Ukraine's military capabilities.
original:
The United States will today announce its intention to send ATACMS missiles to Ukraine as part of a $300 million aid package.

 — Politico

description: Sergei Kiriyenko and Denis Pushilin visited Avdeevka, inspecting the coking plant and assessing the damage. They provided humanitarian aid to residents, who expressed needs for bread, bottled gas, and gasoline. Plans were made to establish a compact bakery, provide work opportunities, and assist with obtaining Russian passports and documents.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
Sergei Kiriyenko and I visited Avdeevka. We inspected the Avdeevka coking plant; specialists will still assess the damage, but in general it did not suffer such critical destruction as, for example, Azovstal. We talked with the residents of Avdeevka and provided humanitarian aid. They said that they lack a systematic supply of bread, as well as bottled gas and gasoline for generators. The tasks of the local administration have already been set. We also plan to involve public organizations.

We will try to install a compact bakery there as quickly as possible. Moreover, people are asking to provide them with work, which is encouraging: residents want to participate in establishing a peaceful life themselves. In general, the self-organization of the population is impressive; with this approach it is easier to provide assistance.

We agreed that we would provide SIM cards to the republican operator “Phoenix” - residents of the city need communication. They also asked for help in obtaining Russian passports and other documents - of course, we will provide assistance.

Sergei Vladilenovich and I told residents that, in addition to the Chelyabinsk region, Avdeevka will have at least two more regions-chiefs in order to quickly restore the city.

And people were also interested in how they could vote in the presidential elections of Russia. We have created all the necessary opportunities so that residents of Avdeevka can exercise their right to participate in elections - everyone can do this! @PushilinDenis

event: Destruction of German Self-Propelled Gun PzH 2000
description: Russian drone pilots successfully detected and destroyed a German self-propelled gun PzH 2000, which was transferred to the Ukrainian Armed Forces, in the village of Seversk, Artemovsk direction. The gun, capable of firing at 30-50 kilometers, was surprisingly positioned only 11 kilometers from the front.
original:
An excellent catch by our drone pilots. It is reported that soldiers of the Russian Armed Forces destroyed in the village. Seversk (Artemovsk direction) German self-propelled gun PzH 2000, which was transferred to the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

It is noteworthy that Seversk is located 11 kilometers from the front. It is not clear why the Armed Forces of Ukraine failed the self-propelled gun, which can shoot at 30-50 kilometers, so closely. The main thing is that the next Western “wunderwaffle” is burning with a blue flame. Know more from Ukraine.ru
